humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that the moderately differentiated squamous carcinoma (metaplastic carcinoma) involving the mammary parenchyma forms a 5.2 x 5.0 x 4.7 cm mass, which is larger than 5 cm. This meets the criteria for a T3 tumor. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma. The presence of skin ulceration and extranodal extension also supports the T3 stage. The number of lymph nodes involved or the presence of metastasis does not affect the T stage.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The tumor size is 5.2 x 5.0 x 4.7 cm, which is larger than 5 cm, and it has skin ulceration. Additionally, there is angiolymphatic invasion present. These factors support a T3 stage according to the AJCC 7th edition (2010) staging system for breast cancer.
